characters: AS IT STARTS TO GET DARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon glows in the sky.  As we tilt downwards, Chri lights twinkle silently in the windows of a courtyard bro The cold December wind howls forlornly.  Although the str is empty, CHRISTMAS CAROLERS can be seen singing in front of one of the buildings. As the carolers move along, a WOMAN appears.  Groceries i tow, she makes her way through the courtyard of her build APPROACHING the doorway.  Fumbling with her keys, she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adjusting a small lightbulb on the wall in the foyer so t can see, the woman begins for the staircase but stops on a small package that's been left at its base.

dialogues.speaker: THE PACKAGE
dialogues.text: is two-tiered.  Wrapped in green, it is tightly secured b bright red ribbon and bow.  Underneath the ribbon, a whit envelope peeks out with the name "KRISTINE" written on it

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN
dialogues.text: shakes her head in disbelief and approaches the gift slow After kneeling to scoop it up, she gazes at it for a mome after tearing open the card, discovers it is signed: "WIT NICK."  Sighing heavily in exasperation, KRISTINE scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom lays quiet.  Although the drapes have been dr keep out the first rays of sunlight, it is grey and overc outside.  Against one wall on a mattress, an unseen lump slumbers uneasily beneath twisted bed sheets. Near the bed, we can see the soft neon glow of a digital radio on the nightstand shift from 6:59 to 7:00.  In an i the morning NEWSCAST fills the room-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) ... EBS news, with news from around the world.  It's seven a.m. in Chicago this Christmas Eve, coming up in this half hour, peace in the middle east is threatened as Jewish and Arab funda- mentalist groups clash in Jerusalem, leaving fifteen dead and twelve injured. Atheist groups continue to boycott at Daley Plaza in opposition to the city's annual holiday display...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND reaches out for the alarm clock from beneath the c as the SLEEPER STIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chicago newspaper with the headline AUTO PLANT LAYS OFF 50,000 WORKERS lies on the stoop.  A byline story adds EC CAN'T FIND YULE CHEER.  Another story at the bottom of th reads CHURCH ROBBED OF CHRIST CHILD STATUE.  The paper is dated DECEMBER 24TH. A FIGURE EXITS THE FOYER in a robe and slippers.  Reachin he picks up the paper and glances at the front page.  26. young man still, despite a creased brow and weariness in suggesting more than just a lack of sleep.  MEET NICK ALL Turning to head back in, he straightens a crooked CHRISTM WREATH hanging on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skyline of Chicago looms wide-shouldered beneath a st grey sky.  Dreary is an understatement- this is a Chicago On Lake Shore Drive, a rain and dirt streaked Celica drif along an entry ramp signaling it's intention to merge wit oncoming traffic.  Once clear, it quickly enters the open lane and is almost side-swept by a speeding MAZDA ZX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacting instantly to avert a collision, Nick watches as DRIVER of the Mazda passes, honks his horn and FLIPS HIM OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredulous, Nick looks around to re-affirm whether or no was in the right.  On the car radio, the Phil Spector ver "Sleigh Ride" can be heard.  Twisting the wheel sharply, angrily fixes his gaze on the car that has almost run him road and filled with adrenaline, he hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's car guns forward in an effort to catch up and pass speeding Mazda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing the distance between himself and the Mazda, Nick suddenly hits the brakes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a POLICE CAR pulls out from the side of the road in pu of the ZX.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON NICK
dialogues.text: who SMIRKS and salutes the driver of the sportscar as he by-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a Merry Christmas to you too my friend-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's laughter can be heard as  his car speeds on toward downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within an office cubicle, Nick gazes lethargically at the screen on his desk.  Around him, fellow employees carry o tasks within the large AD AGENCY they all occupy.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: flips off his computer, his co-worker JAY enters with som folders-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I just finished up that ad for that stupid mailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough for a raise-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, Jay sits on the edge of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get your review?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods, looking up at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning.  Of all days, can you believe that? (beat) You're due for one, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I haven't been here long enough. Two more months-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Two months... two years... I'm begin- ing to think we can never be here long enough for that "raise"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay commiserates with Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it... I mean, your ad copy's great, the mail pieces are sound... it's all bringing in business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... not enough I guess. (more to himself) I can't believe I went to college, got a degree... all it's gotten me is the chance to pimp for this ad agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay begins to laugh but on seeing Nick's impassive demean catches himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, it's Christmas Eve.  You know- holiday spirit... be of good cheer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen" is about all I can think of right now, that and the ghost of bills past, present, and future.  I just wish I can get out of here so I can finish up shopping for my family-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry man, I don't mean to trash your mood.  It's just that I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A  little short on Christmas spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dejectedly) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay pulls aside the folders he's carrying to reveal a fla brightly wrapped Christmas gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... maybe this'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is taken totally aback.  Jay passes the gift along, pleased at himself for having cheered up his friend somewhat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw Jay... you shouldn't have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks the package over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Jay, I didn't have a chance to do any shopping for anyone here... I... I didn't get anything for anyone-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay smiles chidingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick smiles crookedly and looks over the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I open it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering your mood I would say the sooner, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tears away at the wrapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing fancy or anything, just something I picked up at a used book- store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick holds up a book entitled "HOW TO BREAK INTO FILM". He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I that obvious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay nods at some of the movie posters tacked to the walls Nick's cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're always looking ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick flips through the book gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Just don't tell anyone around here, they'd probably can me before I could get something real lined up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks man.  This's really made my day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay smiles, shakes Nick's hand and gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) No problem man.  I gotta fly... I'm meeting Tammy- Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches after Jay, looks down again at his gift and within the solitude of his cubicle, gathers his things to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the area of the Loop where Nick's office is situat Christmas shoppers bustle as the last minute rush begins. Nick walks out of his office building towards Michigan Av and passes a SALVATION ARMY WORKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help the needy sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tosses a few coins into the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, you have a Merry Christmas-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick continues on, he approaches a BAG LADY.  Dressed layered and ratty clothing, she seems to carry all of her belongings in the shopping basket she drags behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you spare some change sir? It'll help with the downpayment on my new condo... (beat) Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slows his step.  Disarmed by the woman's self-effaci humor, he can't help but be charmed by her approach while sympathizing with the seriousness of her plight.  Digging into his pocket, Nick pulls out a five and passes it to t woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir.  Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods.  Pausing to watch her move on, Nick pulls his coat collar close as a sudden wind kicks up.  He then con on down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick guides his car through Lincoln Park towards Broadway Through his windshield, he takes in the images of a CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: outside.  Traffic fills the street.  Holiday banners hang streetlamps while strings of Christmas lights twinkle fro branches of barren trees.  Ignoring the signals, some ped walk into the street causing even more congestion. On the sidewalk, a man dressed in a Santa Claus suit ring bell to attract last minute shoppers.  He waves as Nick p Up the street, shoppers bustle hurriedly in and out of th various storefronts oblivious of each other.  One woman w two kids in tow argues angrily with a meter maid who is a to issue her a ticket because the meter just expired. At another corner, a couple just off work meet and enter for a drink with some friends before retiring home for th evening. They ignore a disabled panhandler begging near t

dialogues.speaker: PASSING A CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Nick sees a solitary old man kneeling.  Laying a wreath a grave of his deceased wife, he then rises and crosses him

dialogues.speaker: AS IT STARTS TO GET DARK
dialogues.text: Nick sees a Christmas tree lot closing up shop.  Along th sidewalk, some indigent people shuffle slowly in no parti hurry since they have no home to go to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gazes almost hypnotically at the array of walkmen, h and other electronic toys in front of him.  The price tag wrapped in holiday bows, are astronomical.  A CLERK comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you sir?  Sir, can I help you find something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick fixates on the display, his attention a million mile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.  Is there something I can help you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances at the clerk, at once snapping out of his da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... no. (sheepishly) If I can't find it myself, I don't think you could help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patting the clerk's shoulder gently, Nick moves towards t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A key is heard at the door.  In an instant, Nick enters t creative hodgepodge of his darkened apartment and in flip on the light, reveals all of his dreams and frustrations. In the livingroom, a drawing board stands in mute testimo to the dozens of sketches in various states of completion taped to it. Along with Nick's graduation certificates, some framed mo posters on the wall overlook an entire shelf bursting at with movie books.  In the front room, a cluttered PC work is situated between an artificial fireplace and steamed u window.  Piled on top of the television cabinet nestled i corner are some videotapes while next to where the couch dwarf-sized Christmas tree decorated with dimestore ornam tilts uneasily to one side.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: dumps his packages on the couch.  Passing an array of hol greeting cards displayed atop the fireplace, he moves som aside on his desk to reveal an ANSWERING MACHINE. Undoing his coat, he pushes PLAYBACK-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hello Nick, this is your Mom. Your sister and brother just got in and we're wondering when we're all going to see you.  Please let us... please let me know when you'll be coming home so I can make up your room.  We all miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine beeps to the next message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey dude, it's Buddy.  A bunch of us are meeting at D'Agostino's to- night around 6:30 for a drink before heading home for Christmas.  Give me a call... let me know if you're coming. Later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden pounding is heard at the front door, startling N Stopping the answering machine, he goes over to open it a KRISTINE standing beyond.  She glares at him harshly.  In hands are the two PACKAGES that were left in her foyer th night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attempting to avoid Kristine's wrath, Nick sheepishly ave attention elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Um... you want to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not answering, Kristine enters.  Shutting the door behind Nick uncomfortably begins to tidy up some things as she f arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, we talked about this.  You just never listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands staring at Kristine, measuring how to respond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake Kristine, what was I supposed to do, just forget about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going out anymore, I told you not to get me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is at a loss for words.  Her rage vented, Kristine s bit, but doesn't stand down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat passes in which Nick collects his thoughts. replies quietly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Christmas.  I thought it'd be the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine paces frustratedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on Nick.  This isn't about Christmas.  You go out and buy me a necklace, and a tape of a movie we watched together during a different time... how am I supposed to take this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine, I got you the necklace, because I thought it would look good on you.  I bought you the movie because I knew it was one of your favorites from when you were a little girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick throws his arms up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we have to argue about this?  It made sense to get them because I figured they'd be things you would like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) But I told you I couldn't accept anything from you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry now) That was after I bought them.  You don't want them, fine.  Give them away.  Throw them away.  But I'll be damned if I'm gonna return a Christmas gift that I bought for somebody.  Anybody, not just you. (frustrated) God why do you have to make such a big deal out of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it always seems that you are calling, or doing things for reasons you're not being up front about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick plops down wearily onto the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just what am I not being "up front" about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanting to get back together. Manipulating Christmas for some- thing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at her, then looks down, cornered by some of truth in her statement.  He massages his temples as Krist sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) I'm not trying to be mean.  I think it's very sweet of you.  But some- times I don't think even you realize some of the reasons why you do the things you do, and it's always going to make me keep my distance.  That's why I told you not to get me anything. That's why it makes me uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrating on the wall, Nick tries to gather his thoug then speaks-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine, I knew you weren't going home for Christmas, I wanted to do something nice. (his voice cracking a little) I don't get through Christmas very well.  Being alone doesn't make it any easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE.  Outside, the wind HOWLS through the apartment's cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick... I get lonely too this time of year, I know it's hard... but thinking about the past is dangerous. This relationship does not work.  We do things too differently.  It makes me sad to think that, when I can re- member all of the things we shared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glumly) Like our hard heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disarmed momentarily, Kristine allows a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like our hard heads. (regaining her composure) We've gotta stop doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine rises, holding out the necklace and tape to Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the receipts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Nick.  No more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods.  The storm between them has passed, despite th delicate truce.  He gets up and walks her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: what are your plans this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.  How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having dinner with my room- mate and her family, then I'm heading out for midnight mass with them in the suburbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stop at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I figure it's the best place to get my head together with everything else being the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not knowing how to say goodbye, Nick shifts awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat passes.  Caught up in her emotions, Kristine embra Nick suddenly, holding him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches after Kristine as she exits the apartment an then closes the door slowly.  After pacing the length of livingroom, he kicks a metal waste can across the room an then surveys the sudden emptiness in his apartment-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some cars pass this cozy little Wrigleyville saloon known D'AGOSTINO'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last call...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner of the back room, a television set tuned in "IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE" rests on top of a wooden perch ju out from the wall.  Below it, Nick sits exasperated over before his pal BUDDY and some other friends who have gath to share a last minute drink to toast the holiday-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) ... I'm really sorry man.  You two still gonna keep in touch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  It's a little hard trying to salvage something, when I still can't figure out why we went bad in the first place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy squints his eyes at Nick, trying to keep up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick snorts derisively at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Maybe I just gotta let it go and give it a rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at his friend empathetically, Buddy tries to offe some words of solace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, I do understand.  Re- member last year when I broke up with Jennifer just before the holidays?  I never thought I'd get through it if it weren't for my family.  That's what the holidays are for man, that's what you've gotta concentrate on, is your family. (raising his beer) Haven't you been home yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I managed putting it off 'til tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointed by Nick's attitude, Buddy shakes his head wi disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) Oh, c'mon Buddy, you know how my family is.  Everybody's so busy talking, nobody ever listens- (beat) It's not anyone's fault, it's just that... everything's already so stressed out that Christmastime, just makes it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think twice about saying that if you ever lost them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at Buddy a moment, then looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When my mom got diagnosed with cancer this year, all I could think about was how important it was to be home with her, because none of us knew how much more time she had. That's when you realize everything else is really bullshit, when all the things that make sense look like they're just about to be yanked out from under you!  And look at her now... she's in remission!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks back up at his friend, recognizing the truth in what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thank God for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy nods.  It's obvious that almost losing his mother h left an everlasting impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it.  She fought it all the way and won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick raises his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sipping from their drinks, the two silently ponder it all the television set above, GEORGE BAILEY sits at MARTINI'S BAR praying for a miracle.  Noticing, Buddy yells up at the barkeep-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bob!!!  Isn't anything else on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB the bartender holds up the remote control and aims it at the television.  Flipping channels only reveals "It's Wonderful Life" on almost every other station although at different points in the movie.  Everyone in the bar howls laughter.  Buddy leans back to pull a few bills from his while Nick contemplates George Bailey's dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signaling Nick to rise) Christmas is what you make of it pal. If Jimmy Stewart can get through it, so can the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Buddy leave D'Agostino's while exchanging "GOODBYES" and "MERRY CHRISTMASES" with their other friends. As the group separates and the lights in the bar grow dim the two start down the icy street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what really sucks Buddy, is that even if stuff was great with my family, even if I was still on decent terms with Kristine, even if I was halfway satisfied with my job, something still wouldn't seem right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like everything!  Take a look around us, everybody's hurting!  I saw this bag lady today, all she wanted was some money so she could eat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well did you give her something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I gave her something... but does it matter?  Is it gonna make a difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) As long as you put forth the effort, it does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy examines his friend, not sure of what other comfort he can offer.  He then holds his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat passes.  Extending his hand, Nick shakes with Budd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) Yeah, well... thanks for listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been there just as many times for me.  Merry Christmas "Saint Nick"... Get home safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The friends part.  As Buddy disappears down the street. Nick looks up at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No snow. (beat) It should snow for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick gazes up into the night sky, a COUPLE pass intent on getting somewhere on time.  Distracted by them, he watches as they scurry past and seeing their destinati follows after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following after the couple, Nick finds himself in front o MUSIC BOX THEATER, a small, refurbished movie palace situated in the middle of the neighborhood.  Beneath the marquee, a group of people stand in line waiting to buy tickets. Looking up, Nick sees the words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of HIGH SCHOOLERS carrying JINGLE BELLS catch Nick's attention.  As they notice him, they all chi "Merry Christmas".  Nick nods, indicating the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one's playing next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's A Wonderful Life."  Last show too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you pay to see "It's A Wonderful Life" when you can see it at home for free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?  They sing Christ- mas Carols right before the show! Come on, you'll have some fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensing that Nick is alone on Christmas Eve, the kids try coercing him into checking out the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'll need one of these-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl passes him one of the JINGLE BELL STRINGS. Nick studies them amusedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you put them to good use!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the high schoolers move on, Nick shakes his head and looks back at the other holiday revelers surrounding Intrigued at their enthusiasm, he clutches the jingle bel close and gets in line to buy a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house lights are dim.  Excited audience members have already filled the small movie palace.  Along the auditor walls, garland and ornaments decorate the terra cotta fac reminiscent of an ornate Spanish village.  In the back of theater, Nick enters with his jingle bells.  Up near the lyrics are projected onto the screen while an ORGANIST playing a huge WURLITZER and the THEATER MANAGER both guide the audience through the last verse of "SANTA CLAUS IS COMING TO TOWN".  As the song finishes, the audience ROARS its approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great!!!  Once again, I want to welcome you all to our Annual Holiday Sing Along!!!  If you haven't been here for this before, although something tells me most of you have,all you have to do is follow along with the lyrics on the screen as our previous song takes on a different... "twist"-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the organist begins, the theater is FILLED with the po of the Wurlitzer's old-fashioned sound.  Energized by it, takes a seat as the theater manager leads the audience in alternate version of "SANTA CLAUS IS COMING TO TOWN" with lyrics behind him on the immense screen that concent on the holidays more ironic aspects-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, you'd better get set, to cough up some dough... here's the sad news in case you don't know... Santa Claus is coming... to town...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Your wife gets the gifts... the kids get the thrills... first of the year you'll get all the bills... Santa Claus is coming, to town!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick watches the crowd around him, he catches sight of the high schoolers who smile and wave their bells at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... And you'll be very lucky... if RIGHT at Christmas time... old Santa Claus brings YOU a tie from the well known five and dime..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling his bells out, Nick waves them back and follows s as the theater manager winds the audience towards the fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, you're gonna be broke so smile and sit still, if he don't get you INCOME TAX will... Santa Claus is coming... TO TOWN!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience applauds wildly.  As they die down, the mana continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were here for the last film, you should already have this one down. Put your hearts into it, because you never know what magic it will cause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "WHITE CHRISTMAS" is played.  As Nick sings along with the audience, we can tell he seems to finally be filled w some warmth.  As the song winds down, a special film loop in the projection booth causes it to look as if it's SNOW within the theater.  Still singing, the audience members their hands together in wild approval. As the song ends, the curtains part to reveal the familia of the LIBERTY FILMS logo while the first strains of the opening music to "IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE" can be heard-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great!!! From the Music Box staff to you and yours, have a safe and happy holiday, and thanks again for coming!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the manager and organist depart from the auditorium, N applauds with the rest of the audience as the FILM BEGINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, a mild snowfall that has already accumulated two makes the Music Box Theater and all of Southport Avenue l like a postcard.  Even after the show ends, small flakes falling as the audience members stream out. Exiting the theater, Nick looks around and smiles.  He is definitely in better spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick begins his journey home through the snow, he sees LITTLE GIRL gazing out from her open apartment window alo the avenue reaching out and catching snowflakes.  As she sight of him, Nick smiles at her and waves up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas!  Hey... you be careful up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Santa Claus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet.  It's still early though.  I'm sure he'll be along while you're asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Momma doesn't think he'll come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's eyebrow raises, a little stunned by her statement. Wondering what she means, he carefully presses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why does your momma think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said first he has to visit the families whose daddies are working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Doesn't your Daddy work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He's dead.  My momma works though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gazes speechlessly at the little girl.  As he puts t two together realizing what hard times the little girl's mother must be facing, she suddenly APPEARS next to her daughter.  Looking a little haggard, the young mother pic daughter up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on honey, it's time to go to bed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking quickly, Nick digs into his coat pocket-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOTHER looks down, noticing Nick for the first time. Wary, she begins to lower the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your little girl told me how you don't think Santa Claus is coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother's face tenses.  A combination of SHAME and RESENTMENT.  Before she can answer though, Nick has pulle the JINGLE BELLS from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since he's so busy, he wasn't sure if he'd be able to get everywhere either, but I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl's eyes brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!!!  I saw him, and he gave me these, and he wanted to make sure that you get them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes a step back and tosses the jingle bells up tow window.  They bounce off the wall and fall back down to h Nick on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing them) Wait a minute.  Get ready now... catch!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the bells again, clearing the window.  As they through, the little girl grabs them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with himself) You take care of those... they belonged to Rudolph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See mommy, I told you Santa would bring something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks up at the mother nervously, not knowing what t expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I wasn't out of place there.  I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother shakes her head and holds her lips tight for f crying.  Not wishing to embarrass the woman, Nick quickly moves on.  Watching after him thankfully, she shuts her w and moves out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks through the silent snow swept streets.  Around the three streets Belmont, Lincoln and Ashland crisscross the streets' juncture is a wide open intersection overwhi abandoned hulk of an out-of-business department store loo Christmas decorations are visible on some buildings, as w twinkling lights.  The avenue itself though, with the exc of one or two passing cars, is barren.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: looks up at the sky, focusing on the constellations. One star shines brighter than the others, TWINKLING in th Nick snorts cynically.  For a moment though, he suddenly imagines that he hears angels singing.  Realizing that th is absurd, he focuses back on the street and sees beyond darkened storefronts a Gothic CHURCH SPIRE cutting upward through the low drifting clouds.  Curious as to the origi the singing, Nick starts walking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick finds himself standing in front of ST. ALPHONSUS CHU Blanketed with snow, the scale of the structure is humbli is the facade.  On each of the four walls situated at the of the steeple, a Roman numeral clock face bears the time O'CLOCK MIDNIGHT. Nick gazes at the open doors of St. Alphonsus.  A few lat can be seen arriving.  Drifting towards the steps, Nick j their ranks and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church is only half-full, not quite matching the numb seen earlier within the Music Box.  A CHOIR sings "O HOLY NIGHT" in a loft at the rear.  Entering from the back, Ni about taking in the solid stone columns and meticulously varnished woodwork.  Interspersed along the walls between half-dozen confessionals are brass plaques depicting the stations of the cross.  Overlooking the altar is a staine window with a giant crucifix hanging in front of it.  Off the side is a small NATIVITY CRCHE. Passing some worshippers, Nick advances respectfully up a aisle towards the front of the church so that he may get view of the CRCHE.  Approaching it, he stops to notice CHRIST CHILD FIGURE is missing. Nick looks around at the congregation gathered for the mi service.  No one seems to notice that the Christ Child fi gone.  Distressed by this, Nick glances around for an USH on spotting one, quickly shuffles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Excuse me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usher notices Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Christ Child figure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usher looks at Nick quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that... your Christ Child figure is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usher nods her head in affirmation, totally unruffled Nick is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but hasn't anybody noticed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, it's been missing since yesterday.  Some teenagers stole it from Father Jacobse, although I can't imagine what they plan on doing with it-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: is having a hard time dealing with the usher's complacenc in the matter.  Around them, the congregation has quieted for the PRIEST who has appeared, preparing to start his sermon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to usher) It's Christmas Eve!  Isn't anybody upset about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usher looks at Nick with a serenity in her eyes that volumes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child may be missing, but his spirit is still in our hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mesmerized by the service around him and the people that come together in worship, Nick glances towards the altar FATHER JACOBSE begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although many of us face troubled times these days, we must always keep in mind that Christmas, is not the holiday where we get what we want... but when we get what we need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the impact of Father Jacobse's words hit Nick like a h he is suddenly transported back to the events of the past hours-

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Jay passes his gift along to Nick-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks man.  This's really made my day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay smiles, shakes Nick's hand and gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) No problem man.  I gotta fly... I'm meeting Tammy- Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Nick digs into his pocket and pulls out some money for th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir.  Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Buddy counsels Nick at D'Agostino's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's what the holidays are for man, that's what you've gotta concentrate on, is your family. (raising his beer) Haven't you been home yet?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Kristine embraces Nick, holding him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas Nick.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The high school girl passes Nick one of her JINGLE BELL STRINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you put them to good use!

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Nick throws the jingle bells up to the little girl as the looks down thankfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your little girl told me how you don't think Santa Claus is coming. Since he's so busy, he wasn't sure if he'd be able to get everywhere either, but I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl's eyes brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!!!  I saw him, and he gave me these, and he wanted to make sure that you get them...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Nick in the electronics store, with the clerk offering as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.  Is there something I can help you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances at the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... no. (sheepishly) If I can't find it myself, I don't think you could help me. (beat) Thanks anyway though.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON NICK
dialogues.text: REALIZING what he's been missing as Father Jacobse FINISH his sermon-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Every now and then we need to look into our hearts, and realize that the source of all the emptiness we sometimes feel, is in not recog- nizing the true spirit of Christmas- the spirit of faith... the spirit of goodwill... and the spirit of under- standing-

dialogues.speaker: NICK'S EYES GLAZE OVER
dialogues.text: Wiping them quickly, he takes a position at the nearest a pew.  As the choir begins singing their energy practicall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Christmas service at St. Alphonsus lets out.  Exiting church amongst the other worshippers, Nick passes the ush joyfully shakes his hand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods, and reflected in his expression is a renewed s optimism not only for himself, but all mankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick makes his way home down the silent snow swept street Climbing up the steps of his building, he lets himself th the first set of doors and enters the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick fumbles with his keys in the dimly lit entryway.  As begins to unlock the second door, he hears a light knock behind him.  Turning, he sees KRISTINE standing outside. Of all the people Nick expected to see at this point in t evening, Kristine is the LAST mon his list.  Regaining hi quickly however, he hastily opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd stop by to see if you still might be here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is still a little dazed by her appearance.  Snapping ushers her in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine enters the foyer, Nick closing the door behind t The two face each other awkwardly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I tried calling first, but all I got was your machine-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat passes, leaving Nick to further wonder as to meaning behind Kristine's visit.  Kristine herself seems uncertain.  Sensing this, Nick breaks the ice-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your night... how was church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... It was really good- (beat) There are just a few things that I needed to come by here and tell you tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gazes at Kristine not knowing what to expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering) I was pretty hard on you earlier and...  I kept thinking through the service that, regardless of what we've been through, you have always been there for me and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuffles nervously, her guard now totally down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I wanted you to know that I appreciate it, and... I wanted to thank you-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: gazes at Kristine in disbelief, thankful at the fact that reconciliation is dawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even tried to get you something, but... everything was closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick rolls his eyes self-effacingly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how this whole thing started...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristine laughs, and the two are suddenly struck by the absurdity of their situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Kristine, I'm really sorry that those things I bought you put you on the spot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just forget about it, really... (meeting his eyes) It's Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kristine stand shivering in the cold, unwilling part but not quite knowing where to go next.  Nick glance outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... how 'bout the snow... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come up for a minute? I could make you some hot chocolate-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm... yeah... you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pondering uncertainly whether or not Nick's suggestion is one, Kristine relents after a moment and then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: opens the door.  It is an emotional moment, and despite t lessons both he and Kristine have learned during this col winter solstice, each still feels very much alone.  For n though, they have found some comfort in each other throug the peace that comes from understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just one thing I've gotta do first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick and Kristine head up the staircase, the dank Dece wind outside howls quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although it is dark, we can still see snowflakes falling. apartment dominates the frame.  As we pull back from it, in his livingroom window goes on, after which we can see SILHOUETTED while picking up the phone and dialing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi mom, it's me... I'm sorry I'm calling so late.  No, no, everything's fine, really.  I just wanted to let you to know that I'll be over first thing in the morning. I love you too.  Merry Christmas-

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS
